Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Greetings to Syrian President 
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, Monday sent a message of greetings to Bashar al-Assad, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party and president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on the occasion of the 34th anniversary of the corrective movement in Syria.
 The message noted that the corrective movement marked a landmark occasion as it brought about an epochal turn in the efforts of the Syrian people to build developed and modern Syria under the wise leadership of their eternal leader Hafez al-Assad and the president.    
 The message extended full support to the Syrian people in their just cause of meeting the pressure and challenge of foreign forces, defending the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation and retaking the occupied Arab territories including Golan Heights. It wished the president good health and happiness and the friendly Syrian people greater progress and prosperity.

Kim Il Chol Meets New Cuban Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, today met and conversed with new Cuban Ambassador e.p. to the DPRK Ruben Perez Valdes who paid a courtesy call on him.                                   .
 On hand were general officers and officers of the KPA and the military attache of the Cuban embassy here.

Government Delegation of Japan Flies Back
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A government delegation of Japan led by Mitoji Yabunaka, chief of the Asia and Oceania Bureau of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, flew back today after participating in the inter-governmental working-level contact between the DPRK and Japan.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Observes Anniversary of Corrective Movement in Syria
articles.content:
Greetings to Syrian President
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- .Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Bashar al-Assad, president of Syria, on the occasion of the 34th anniversary of the corrective movement in Syria.
 The message said that after the corrective movement conducted under the wise leadership of Hafez al-Assad, eternal leader of the Syrian people, they have defended the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation and achieved social progress and prosperity.    
 It wished the Syrian people greater success in their struggle to seek a fair and comprehensive solution to the Middle East issue and step up country's modernization under the guidance of the Baath Arab Socialist Party as well as the president good health and happiness.

Paek Nam Sun Meets EU Troika Delegation
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun met and had a conversation with the Troika delegation of the European Union at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
 Present there were officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of Germany, Britain, Sweden, Poland and the Czech Republic here.

For. Diplomats Visit Palestinian Embassy to Mourn Death of Yasser Arafat
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic Envoys,  representatives of international organizations and embassy officials here Monday visited the Palestinian embassy here to express condolences over the death of Yasser Arafat, president of the State of Palestine, chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization and head of the Palestinian National Authority.
  They made entries in the mourner's book.

Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Palestinian Embassy
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il today sent a wreath to the Palestinian embassy here expressing deep condolences over the death of Yasser Arafat, president of the State of Palestine, chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization and head of the Palestinian National Authority.
 The wreath was laid before his portrait rimmed with a black ribbon.    
 The ribbon of the wreath bore letters "In Memory of HE Yasser Arafat.
 Kim Jong Il".
